item.description:
Taken from the Publisher's website:

it is a card game for 2, 3, 4 players. Form your Tribe and start your battle facing the attacks of wolves, buffalos and eagles that your adversaries will try to throw on you! The challenge starts! 
You must do more points than your adversaries forming one or more patrols built with your own cards. The player who first arrives to 100 points wins. The points are obtained by the red ability spheres at the base of the tribe cards or of the passive defense cards (1 ability sphere = 1 point).

Content:
1 handbook with rules; 90 playing cards.

Taken from the Publisher's Website

It is a boardgame for 2 players that defy each other forming their team composed of 5 elements each one with different abilities of contrast/shot, with the aiming of score more goals than the adversary. Every player puts his players onto the field according to his tactical choices and makes the actions trying to get free from marking the adversary and to shoot at goal.

Content:
1 handbook with rules; 1 game board (the football field); 20 cardboard shapes (the 2 teams); 20 little plastic bases; 6 cardboards balls; 1 ball (plastic pawn); 2 dice (1-6); 1 plus/minus dice (+/-).

From the publisher's website:

8 brave heroes fight for the treasure of Karmox fortress. Only one will be the winner! Choose your character or your team to start your treasure hunting; the characters increase their level during the game defeating the adversaries; from the life points of the adversaries one gets the level points that will then be transformed into ability points used to increase the player's attack or defense or movement. Exploit the "event" chart that will allow you also to call for the "warrior spirit" that will help you during the most critical moments.

Content:
1 handbook with rules; 1 modular game board; 60 pawns to score points; 1 red pawn; 1 blue pawn; 2 6-sided dice; 8 "warrior spirit" cards; 1 "event" mini game board; 8 character charts; 8 characters (cardboard shapes); 8 coffers (cardboard shapes); 16 little plastic bases (to keep the cardboard shapes)

Objective: try to understand the thoughts of the other players
 - collect as many (matching) chips as possible.
Within of many dragons dominated (illustrated) Europe (map) you see very nice & cute drawings all over the board.
The players try to be right with their guesses about the linkage of attributes and drawings.
Example:
The two adjectives 'enviable' and 'fiery' can be related to 
'Flamenco' in Spain or to a 'love couple' image in Denmark.
If you match the active player's decision you score (chips).

5star is a racing game for 2 players in which the number 5 on the dice serves to allow new stars onto the board. After this it's a race to the finish. The first player to get 5 stars over the finish line is the winner. Stars can be captured by both your own stars as well as by opponent stars. Whenever a star is on the fifth or tenth position on the track, it's prone to capture the oppenent if he/she moves a star to the same rank.

Multiple games can be combined to allow for more than 2 players.

5star is designed by the mother-and-daughters trio Linda, Isis and Nova.

Objective:
Replay of the economical stuff learned on middle school
game ends after 90 min ==> winner: most points/money

Economic & educational game (simulation of a company producing
teenage furniture) 
Check - if pupils have learned economic stuff successfully 
 - moving/acting by turn -

players roll the die, move their meeples; if you land on a marked area draw a card:
cards have questions coming out from 
a. calculation (cash discount, credits, stocks...)
b. accounting (different business cases)
c. cost-benefit analysis
d. economic analysis / spreadsheets
solving these questions takes time, because most often you have
to find a problem-solving approach, subsequently to calculate getting correct result
collecting bonus points/money to get awarded

DKT, das kaufmännische Talent, is an Austrian equivalent for the well-known "Monopoly".

Your object is not to be the last still in play, but to be the first to pay back your debts and thus win the game. Players start with 2000 units of money and choose 1 to 3 start actions, depending on the number of players, either buying a plot of land or taking out a loan. Player rolls the die - first he moves a tourist marker and implements the spot reached for him. Then he moves his own marker and implements the game reached - special spots or buying, building, paying rent or either paying back a loan or taking out an additional loan.

In this dynamic version there are a few major changes, which make for interesting decisions and the game quicker:
You move two tourists with a third die.
To win the game, you have to pay back your starting money.
The Hotel is not just a fifth house, but is worth 100 for each house in the area/city.

DKT, das kaufämnnische Talent, is an Austrian pendant for the well-known Monopoly. This version is very similar to »DKT dynamic«, but it has some party-elements.
As in DKT dynamic the goal is to pay back the starting money. The prices of the alpine regions change with the seasons. On two fields, all the players have to perform a task (depending on the season). The last one has to pay …

Hier wird in den alpinen Tourismus investiert. Die Spieler erstehen Grundstücke in den Alpen und versuchen sie durch den Ausbau mit Hütten und Hotels lukrativ zu machen, ihr Geld zu mehren und schuldenfrei zu werden. Sommer- und Wintertourismus erfordern unterschiedliche Aktivitäten und Touristenattraktionen.

It's a race up the mountain! Beat the other players to various Mont-Royal landmarks.
After rolling 4 dice, a player will choose two dice pairs and advance his coloured tokens along the paths available of the appropriate sums of the pairs. As soon as one player has advanced their token to the last position along a path, they can claim that landmark and no other player may advance along that path.

This game was designed and printed to be a give-away for all attendants to the 2011 Montreal 60 second film festival, M60, registration party.

Contents
1 Game Platform.
1 Contract Board.
1 Pack of Contract Cards
1 Pack of Box Office Journal Cards.
1 Pack of Publicity Cards.
1 Pack of Audience Cards.
2 Packs of Artists Cards.
Various Money Tokens.
6 Counter's.
16 Pegs.
2 Dice.
1 Set of Rules.

"Make the Headlines With the Stars of Your Own Choice - Every Player is an Impresario"

The objective is to Become a Successful Agent. Each Player is an agent and by shrewd handling of the stars they represent they will hope to accumulate money. It is a standard roll dice and move round the board. You get hired by stars (the cards feature real photos of popular British stars of the 50's) and you hope to find them work. Features Include - Audience Cards,Star Ratings Chart,Contracts, Publicity and Hit or Flop.
The first player to make £50,000 has proven to be successful and is the winner of the game.

Stars include - Dickie Valentine, James Arness, Tommy Trinder, Benny Hill, Lucille Ball, Petula Clark and many more.

D.o.D. - Dice or Date is a board game that can involve a minimum of 2 to a maximum of 6 players, in a world populated by Nerd trying to get an appointment with Amata, the most beautiful and proud girl of the City.
Help your Nerd collecting treasures to finally cross the three different dates Gate (Amata's family, his colleagues and her friends) that lead to the beautiful Beloved and her cold disdain for our protagonists.
Through a fully illustrated game board, consulting and moving pieces of plexiglass, players can choose between 6 different Nerd (specialists in many subjects: horror, science fiction, comics, TV series, Internet and video games, fantasy) willing to challenge themselves through direct competitions, Events , crossroads of the Devil, Retail and Fortress of Solitude.

Trivia game about classic popsongs in the Dutch top 40. It's a music trivia game.

Each player fills the answers of the classic popsongs onto the sheets. The player with the highest score, wins the game.

Contents
1 rulebook
1 book with track information
1 CD with 396 musicfragments
6 chips
6 pencils
1 notebook with sheets
1 sandtimer

Starting with $25,000 and a studio car, players traverse the gameboard with script in hand with the goal of meeting the requirements to complete their movies. Players roll and move with the usual assortment of chance elements found in board games such as these, but they are free trade and barter at will. The first to complete one’s assigned script requirements is the winner.

Solar Empire:CCG is a new card game, its a space warfare game based on solar system conflict and space combat. Its made for 2 players, 8 years and older, the game itself uses cards to represent spaceships, planets and special effects. Its basically a deck dueling game, where players build their own decks and play against another player across a table. The cards are high quality, the rules are easy to understand, and it has replay value due to the variety of cards and player strategies. The object of this game is to capture all the opponent's planets before your card deck is exhausted. All cards are played face down, the planets are setup at the start of play, face up, as the game progresses ship and special effects cards are revealed, players tally their victory points and the winner is decided. The game play time is from 30 minutes to 1 hour depending on the number of planets in play. Its a portable game using only cards, there are no dice, charts, or tokens involved, all a player needs is their own deck and they are ready to play.

You play a mastermind, sending your agents to gather control over matters momentous and sinister. The threads come together to put a person in a place at a time. It is by such capers that you will prove your superlative … mastermindery? You are not sure that's a word, but your genius cannot be contained by the bounds of vocabulary.

In this auction game, players bid a number of agents that they will commit to a task. The high bidder takes a card. Agents committed to taking the card eventually return. If there is a tie in the initial auction, players bid delay - an extra amount of time they are willing to wait before getting their agents back.

This is one of the games included in The Revised and Expanded Decktet Book.

Sometimes your friends can be so annoying that you just want to hit them. Especially that guy on your left.

This is a quick, brutal game by Chris DeLeo. Each turn, you make an attack against the player on your left. If they fail to defend, then they take the attack cards into their hand. The goal is to get rid of all the cards in your hand after the draw pile has been exhausted. Being the first player to do so is nice, but being the second player to do so is just as good. The loser is the last player left holding cards.

This game is exclusively available in The Decktet Book.

Contents
1 3D Playing Board(Battle Ground).
2 Spring Loading Guns.
10 Figure's.
2 Bullets.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Lid.
'The Blues and the Greys'.
Ambush is a Game of Strategy and Accurate Shooting. The object is to get your men to the enemy gun position to win the game.
The game is played on a three dimensional board. The soldiers need the hills to protect them from enemy fire, which is real enough, as you get to fire bullets at the advancing soldiers with your spring-loaded gun.

The winner is the first to reach the enemy's gun position.

Contents
1 Game Board.
4 Cars.
16 Shops(4 Green/12 Red).
8 Traffic Lights.
8 Pedestrians.
4 One Way Street Arrows.
16 Treasury Notes(Two Denominations).
1 Pack of Traffic Control Cards. 
8 Conical Obstruction Pieces.
1 Set of Rules.

Each player sets out from their home garage on a shopping expedition by car. They first head for the Bank to draw money sufficient to cover their purchases (Note: No cash machines or credit cards 55 years ago). Then the players proceed to the various shops to spend the money. Finally, the players return to the Bank to draw money to take home.

The first player having made the required value of purchases and arrived back in their garage with the correct amount of money, wins the game.

Look out for traffic lights, pedestrians, one way streets and obstructions as you shop.

Pebble Rebel is a strategy game for two players. Each player has different goals and different ways of playing, but still get in each other's way.

If Pebble gets four stones of the same color in a row, horizontally or vertically, she wins. (Diagonal four-in-a-row does not count.)
If Rebel fills up the whole board, he wins.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Background:

The depths of the oceans were the last unexploited frontier on our world, until scientists detected a new element formed by the combination of high pressure and intense volcanic heat.

The element, Gottahavium, exists as a quantum fluid. This wonder element acts as a super conductor, and would launch a new epoch in technology for all humankind, and the Conglomocorporation that controls stands to make a fortune.

Since Gottahavium can only be found in deepest reaches of the ocean, a very inhospitable places for humans, Deep Sea Drones (DSDs) are utilized to locate and then mine the deposits.

With so much on the line, the ConCorps have covertly shifted resources from military contracts to ensure they will be the sole proprietors. And so, a quiet little war has sprung up under the sea.

				
					Gameplay:

Each player controls one of three ConCorp exploratory forces, which are vying for control of the limited deposits in the volatile oceanic depths.

The game is patterned after the classic Micro/Mini-games in the late 70’s early 80’s, and is meant to be a light quick wargame that can be played in a single session.

Before starting, players must choose the scale of the game they wish to play. This can range from a small skirmish, allowing for multiple sessions in a night, or have a much larger scale conflict that would allow for a much more in depth battle.

Once the size of the game is decided, player will pick a ConCorp to represent, and the pick their force of DSDs. Each ConCorp has 5 different drones to choose from, with an overall theme for each of the 3 ConCorps.

After setup, players take turns mining & moving, with a simultaneous fire phase between each player’s move phase, so as not to give any one player an advantage in being able to move in, without repercussions.

However, this is not just a straight up shooting gallery. As with many games of this genre, the map is hex based, and the terrain has an impact on both movement and combat. There are also oceanic events, such as strong currents, undersea volcanoes and seaquakes that provide a random element that can ruin even the best-laid plans of AIs and Drones.

While the main goal is to attempt to mine a set number of resources (depending on game size), players can also take a more offensive stance and attempt to annihilate the other player’s base going for the more brutal total victory.

				
					The Future?:

The game was created as part of the Microgame contest here on BGG, but there are plans to expand it beyond the bounds of the initial restraints of that contest.

The goal will be to release expansion modules over time, which will add new drones, ConCorps , maps and rules, all of which will be compatible with the existing system, including having map halves being interchangeable.

Contents 
4 Boxes of Puzzle Pieces.
Central Pool Puzzle Pieces.
1 Set of Rules.

"A game of skill and chance that combines the fascination of Jig-Saw construction with the thrill of a race game." says the box and going on to say "Not just an ordinary Jig-Saw, but an entirely new idea that leaves the result of the race a speculation to the last piece."

Each player has one of the colour coded boxes of pieces.
There is also a central pool of pieces for the water jump.
Players begin their puzzles - This forms part of their race track. Once their piece's are used up,the water jump is made, using pieces from the centre pool. The winner is the first one to complete their track the fastest (including the water jump).

The rules suggest that counters may be used For side stakes if required.

From the back of the box (translated from dutch):

Roll the die and answer the question of the colour you rolled. A right answer gives you a token of the same colour. The moment you earn a token your turn is over. Collect all 6 tokens and answer the six questions of the next question card you draw. If you correctly answer 3 questions, you're the winner of the game.

The six categories are: actors and actresses (blue), directors and movie music (pink), classics (yellow), general knowledge (red), movie titels (green), childrens movies and animation (orange).

Contents
2 Clamps.
2 Wooden Poles.
1 Ball.
7 Wood Skittles

Indoor game that lends itself to skittle games where you swing round a ball on a string, trying to knock down the skittles as it sweeps by. In England this type of game was always known as Bar Skittles.

Skittle-Tennis has a ball on a string but the string is longer and must be hit with a bat rather than out of the hand.

The skittles are rated for different point values. Obviously, you should try to knock over the higher scoring ones. The first player to score 100 points is the winner.

From the rules "An interesting game that can produce an excellent method of training the eye for both Table Tennis and Tennis.

There are some game variants in the rules.

link.value: KUM-BAK Sports, Toys, & Games, MFG Co. Ltd

item.description:
Contents
1 Poolette Wheel.
2 Metal Ballbearings.
1 Board with Colours and Numbers.
1 Board for Chips.
1 Set of Rules.

This game consists of a wheel similar to a Roulette wheel, a board which holds the bank's 'money', a stake board, a couple of ball bearing and a box of counters (Emu, made in England). The game was made by R. Cox Products Ltd. of Worcester but there's nothing to say on the rules when it was made. The picture on the lid shows a very posh gentleman croupier.

The game is all about betting. One player acts as the banker (until Pass Bank is decided on the wheel and then the bank passes to the left).Players place their bets on any number of colours.
Also the Winning Division Which Denotes - the Odds to Be Paid Out.

Some of the Divisions Are:
ODDS(Stakes Paid Out at Rate Indicated on Winning Colour).
POOLETTE(All Stakes Go Into a Pool Including Winning Colour).
BANKER TAKES POOL(Banker Takes All Stakes on Board and Pool).
WINNERS TAKE POOL(Stakes Divided Plus Any Pool).
DOUBLE STAKES RE-RACE(All Stakes on Board Doubled - Spin Again).

Religious trivia game. "A religious game for catholic children" from Leipzig in East Germany at the time.

Up to 14 players get a card with room on it to place six cards. A question is asked about the Bible and if someone recognises the passage, and correctly, they get the card to put on their board. First to get all six spaces filled, wins the game.

This game has been published by dV Giochi as a reward for winning the 2010/2011 edition of the Gioco Inedito – Best Unpublished game contest. Powered by Lucca comics & Games and dV Giochi, the contest aims to identify the best new card game design from all prototypes received and to reward it by publishing the game in a fully professional and high-quality format, overseen directly by dV Giochi. All prototypes submitted must conform to the technical and style requirements, fixed components and a given theme which changes every year. Everybody can join the contest and this is a great opportunity for emerging game designers to see their idea published. For more information:
giocoinedito@luccacomicsandgames.com
www.luccacomicsandgames.com

In The Gang, players try to play cards to capture gang members – with both gangs at risk of being captured. To set up each of the three cities in the game, draw five gangster cards at random, then place them in a row in numerical order (with a range of 1-80). Even and odd cards belong to different gangs and are color-coded. Each player has a hand of four gangster cards and a random special action card.

On a turn, each player chooses one gangster and one city card/one special card, then they reveal them simultaneously. Players place cards in ascending order from lowest to highest. If a gangster was played with a city card, it's placed in that city in the proper numerical spot; if it was played with a special card, it can be placed in any city, with the special card being placed in the same city before or after the gangster. If the card you placed is one of two gangsters surrounding at least two gangsters of the other color, then you capture the surrounded gangsters and remove them from play. Special cards let you play on the end of a row, switch a gangster from even to odd (or vice versa), or move a gangster from one row to another.

After four rounds, players discard their special card (if it hasn't been played), then receive a new hand of four gangsters and a special card. Any rows with fewer than five cards are filled to five cards. The game continues until not enough cards remain to fill players' hands and the rows; when this happens, the game ends immediately and players count the revolvers on the gangsters they've captured. The player with the high score wins.

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Contents
1 Playing Board.
6 Dougal Playing Pieces.
1 Dice.
Instructions Are Printed on Inner Box Lid.
Game based on characters from the BBC children's series, in particular, Dougal the dog.

Each player chooses a Dougal figure. The game is the story of Dougal looking for his sugar. The story starts at space Number 1 on the board and finishes at Number 63. The first player to reach the centre of the board at space Number 63 is the winner.

The players draw cards, stand one behind the other and put one hand on the person in front as shown in the cards they drew. The first player picks up the wooden baton and ball standing in front of him/her and carefully passes it on to the next player. If the baton and ball arrive at the last player everyone has won that round of the game.

Fun and skill are the most important here. Pipifax develops body awareness, balance and team spirit and trains the recognition of different positions.

Contents
1 Wooden Base.
2 Tree Trunk Sections.
1 Palm Leaf Connector Unit.
4 Green Palm Leaves.
1 Chimpanzee.
12 Monkey's in Four Colour's.
2 Dice.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Lid.

A race game but you are racing up the plastic palm tree instead of around a board. Each player has an equal share of the monkeys. Dice are thrown to climb (Each notch is 4 apart).

The monkeys want to get to the fruit at the top of the tree - therefore the objective is to climb the tree as quickly as possible. The first to get all their monkeys on to one of the palm leaves, is the winner.

Beware the black chimpanzee as he wants all the fruit and will chase the monkeys down when he catches them. The chimpanzee moves when a double is thrown and tries to catch the monkeys.

The players put plastic discs onto their flower cards. They throw the dice to obtain the plastic discs but they must also be careful about how they combine them. Only if the right discs are put on top of each other will the correct flower colour emerge.

Contents:
• 4 wooden flower cards (180 x 140 x 4 mm) 
• 1 dice with colours and symbols 
• 24 round plastic discs 
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box

Contents
1 Surface Area.
11 Red Bulb Covers.
11 Yellow Bulb Covers.
1 White Bulb Cover.
1 Question/Answer Booklet.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Lid.

An electric (battery operated) quiz game, based on the early days of a BBC game show with this name. The questions are from General Knowledge categories.

The board shows various routes to the goal. The shorter the route taken means harder questions but you save a lot of time.Quiz Ball Game

The Game features 500 Questions - With real flashing lights and a buzzer noise!

Contents
1 Three - Dimensional Playing Field.
2 Galleon's.
4 Blue Buccaneer's.
4 Red Pirates.
4 Gold Bars.
Palm Trees.
2 Dice.
1 Dice Shaker.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Lid.

Players are either Buccaneers or Pirates

Gold Bars are placed at the summit on the island and crews Start/Finish at their respective galleons. The routes have hazards such as 'Drop Your Gold' and these must be obeyed. These are marked on the board and full instructions for their use are inside the game lid.

The object is to get each crew member to the summit, pick up a Gold Bar and race back to the Galleons.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Boardgame released by Denys Fisher in the seventies as part of the Comic Action Heroes line of toys. 
It's an official DC licensed version, and includes the heroes Superman, Batman, Robin and Shazam against the villains Joker, Riddler, Mr Freeze and the Penguin.
It's a fairly basic roll and move game, where the object is to reach the top of the 3-d cityscape that clips onto the board, but the playes also control the movement of the villains to hinder your opponents progress.

Contents
1 Playing Surface.
4 Picture Cards(9 Holes). 
1 Golf Figure and Base.
2 Balls.
4 Markers.
1 Flag and Base.
1 Direction Indicator.
Scorecards.
1 Set of Rules.

From the box "Enjoy playing at many famous courses including St Andrews, Carnoustie and Hoylake. Pitch, Putt, Hook, Slice - Play the outdoor game the indoor way!"

The game is supplied in 2 Parts;
1.A soft playing surface where all strokes are taken.
2.Picture Cards of the course, hole by hole, on which results are recorded, (by placing markers), the distance and position of each stroke. There is a heavy ball which is used for all strokes until the green is reached, and a lighter ball for putting.

Select a hole to play and decide how far you would like to hit the ball. Then, using the golfer figure, you whack the ball, trying to limit the distance you need to ball to end up. Then you advance the marker on the hole card and note any penalties that might occur - Hook,Slice Etc. When the green is reached, use the lighter ball to putt.

Contents
1 Game Board.
1 Dice.
1 Playing Piece Car.
3 Playing Piece Motorcycles.
1 Rules Sheet.

Simple die rolling game. From the start, you move round the track, obeying instructions on special squares. The first player to cross the finish line, wins.

On the cusp of the twentieth century, America is the undisputed land of industry. Factories fire their machines twenty-four hours a day, and demand is skyrocketing in the cities. A small but fierce rivalry of shipping barons must manage their amazing airships and the extensive railroad system in order to get goods to the cities before the demand is met by someone else. Anyone who can't stay competitive will be left with nothing but dust in their coffers!

The process is simple: Factories produce the goods (machinery, textiles, chemicals, food, and luxuries) that are coveted by the city folk. Airships – forbidden from landing in the cities but capable of carrying cargo over great distances – must be used to gather those goods and deliver them to depots along the rail network. Trains then haul the goods to the cities that want them, earning cash for the competitor who gets there first! Will you be the "King of Air and Steam?"

Kings of Air and Steam spans five rounds, and at the beginning of each round, players plan their Airship flights using four of their movement cards. When everyone is ready, everyone reveals their first planned card. According to the turn order and movement limits of their cards, players move their Airships, then take an Action; Actions include Building Depots, Upgrading your Airship or Train, Shipping Goods by rail, and Soliciting Funds from the bank. When all players have acted, the second planned cards are revealed, and so on through the four planned cards until all players have finished carrying out their plans for the round. All the while, players must keep aware of the rising values of the different types of Goods and try to get the most-valuable Goods from the specialized factories that produce them to the cities that want them. At the end of the game, the player with the most money and the greatest shipping network will be declared King of Air and Steam!

Kings of Air and Steam includes seven teams of characters, each with unique powers to give them a competitive edge, and a modular game board that makes each game a different experience.

link.value: Kings of Air and Steam: World's Fair

item.description:
Published in a limited edition, plastic leather pack to celebrate the 10th anniversary of dV Giochi, Dieci is a trick-taking game with illustrations taken from many dV Giochi titles. The players are "Radiatov", a race of aliens who want to collect artwork from particular games.

To start the game, each player receives ten cards (with some cards removed for fewer than six players and a smaller hand size for 7-8 players) as well as a secret goal card. Cards come in five suits valued from 2 to A. The top card of the remaining deck is revealed to show a trump suit, and three of the 30 characters are laid face-up.

The trick-taking in Dieci is fairly standard: One player leads a card, with everyone else following suit if possible and throwing off (or playing trump) if not possible. The highest trump card claims all cards in the trick; if no trump was played, then the highest card regardless of suit wins the trick. The player claiming the trick must then claim one face-up character card bearing a suit played in that trick; if no such character is face-up, the player claims the top character card from the deck. Going clockwise, each player then claims a remaining character card or passes; once everyone has passed or all characters have been claimed, the next trick begins.

Once the character deck runs out, the game ends. Players score:


 One point for each card claimed.
 A variable number of points (0-20) depending on how many characters they took that are shown on their secret goal card.
 Their lowest-valued character card in each of the five suits. For each other character in a suit, they lose points equal to that character's value.


The player with the highest score wins.

Domino Sudoku combines the familiar number placement rules of Sudoku with numbered domino tiles with players competing for the highest score.

To set up the game, shuffle the number tiles face down; remove as many tiles from the game as the number of players, then take one of these tiles and place it face-up on the table as the starting tile.

On a turn, a player reveals a tile, then adds it to the array of tiles on the table. The numbers on the tile must be oriented in the same direction; at least one number on the tile must be placed adjacent to an existing tile; and no number can be added to a row or column that is already present in that row or column. After placing a tile, the player earns as many points as the number of numbers in the row(s) and column(s) to which the tile was added. (Skip gaps in a row or column when summing points.) If by placing a tile, a player completes a row or column with nine different numbers, he scores ten bonus points.

Once all the tiles have been placed, the game ends and the player with the highest score wins.

For the solo game, remove ten tiles at random, using one of them as the starting tile. Try to score as many points as you can!

item.description:
In July 1809 the largest British expeditionary force ever assembled weighed anchor off the Kent coast and sailed for the island of Walcheren in the Scheldt estuary.
The map of Walcheren 1809 represents the Southern part of the Walcheren Island and the fortress of Flushing (Flessingue or Vlissiningen), the theatre of the battle. 
 The players have two different tasks. The British player has to march towards Flushing fortress in order to avoid a strong occupation by enemies. In order to do so he risks attrition and diseases. In effects there was fighting with the French, but the worst casualties were inflicted by diseases. Dysentery and other infectious illnesses arising from the unhealthy swampland killed thousands and incapacitated many more, causing the abandonment of the inglorious expedition.
The British lost over 4,000 men to a disease called "Walcheren Fever", thought to be a combination of malaria and typhus.

The French player has two options:
1- attack the British columns try to delay their advance
2- retreat inside Flushing and flood the area nearby (mining the dams)

Victory is assigned to the British player by controlling the fortress of Flushing. The French player wins if he has the control of Flushing while having eliminated 10 British units. Any other outcome is a draw.

Other kids' games are all such a bore!
They've gotta have rules and they gotta keep score!
Calvinball is better by far!
It's never the same! It's always bizarre!
You don't need a team or a referee!
You know that it's great, 'cause it's named after me!
—The Calvinball theme song

Calvinball is a game played by the characters of the classic comic strip Calvin and Hobbes by Bill Watterson.

The goal of Calvinball is to round the circuit of bases in sequence while in the possession of the required Calvinball for each base. One time successful around the bases wins the game. Opponents will attempt to halt other Player’s advancement while simultaneously trying to reach their own sequential base with their Calvinball (it may or may not be the same ball). Scattered around the field are trees, rocks, a stream, sports equipment and other items to hinder and assist players in their efforts to win the game

item.description: A Chess-like move and capture game played on an 8 x 8 board which includes terrain, which enables ambushes, has swamps to avoid and forts into which retreats may be conducted, but which may also be besieged.

name.value: The Game of the Red Pig

item.description:
Game circa 1930's from Parker Brothers.

This is sort of a spin and move game where depending on what number you get from the spinner you move forward that number of places on the board. There are certain places on the board with special letters on them. Those spaces allow you to move forward extra spaces. Landing on places with Black dots make you move back some number of spaces. First to finish wins!

Box says: Explore the great city of Paris from the comfort of your home. A strategy-travel game, for 2-6 players. #7471, 1974 Gameophiles Unlimited, Inc. 16 Pine St., Morristown, NJ 07960. Patent Pending.

Roll the die and move. Land on special squares and pick cards that move you to different places like the Louvres Museum or the Eiffel Tower, Arch of Triumph, Church of Sacre Couer etc. Enter the city from Orly Airport, The Palace at Versailles, Longchamps or Colombey. See the needed number of places in the city to win the game.

name.value: ZOMBIES! You Won't Survive The Night.

item.description:
Well, it's finally happened. It might have been a plague, some sort of crazy military experiment, or just a freak mutation of some virus; but it doesn't matter, the dead are walking and they are hungry!

ZOMBIES! You Won't Survive The Night is a Zombie-themed card game where you and your friends make up a party of survivors who are doing their best to simply survive. The only problem... They won't! You cannot survive this night! Everyone WILL DIE!!!

While you and your friends are trying to make it, you will go into houses and businesses looking for food and weapons. On occasion, you might just find a Zombie... Of course, dealing with the Zombies in a large group (Up to 10 players) might seem easy at first but eventually you lose people... and when you do, they become Zombies too!

Play doesn't end when you die, your priorities simply change. Once you die and become a Zombie, your goal is simple: Kill all the living and eat their brains!

Will you be the last to survive? Will you be the last Zombie standing? Each play-through will be different in this game of tactics and chance.

Objective: collect/gain as many tiles/chips with quality fishes 
as possible
- moving by turns
1. players place their meeples on the board (circle) - youngest one starts 
2. turn a tile (fish is shown)- try to catch it by
3. rolling the dice - move your meeple (forewards or backwards)
4. or move the octopus - to block the loot 
5. pick up the loot - if accessible
6. flip over another tile/fish - later on 2 tiles at once
7. game ends if no tiles are available 
Player with high score (most valuable fishes) wins

GolFUNator is a strategic golf board game.Each player begins with the ability of an average Pro Golfer (stats taken from the 2010 PGA Tour Season). The course, Highland Peaks is a ficticional par 72 course.

Players choose the type of shot they will take. Choices range from safe, normal, or all-out from the tee, and safe, middle (of the green) or Go (for the pin) on approach shots. There are also other choices during play. On putts from the fringe and distances over 25', the player may choose 'GO' or 'LAG'. Almost anything that can happen in real golf, can happen in GolFUNator. 6 times per round, if the player hits an errant shot (trouble) he may choose to use one of his/her 6 'LUCK' cards. The results will be either good, bad, or no luck at all. 
A player can get HOT by getting 2 birdies in a row. He/she may also become COLD with 2 bogeys in a row.

The game comes with a 14x14" HD laminated cardstock 2-sided board, 2 10-sided dice, 5 decks of cards, markers, scoresheets and instructions.

An extraordinary game.
The game is played on any reasonable sized table. 2, 4 or 6 players can play.

This must be a forerunner of football games like Subbuteo. But, instead of little footballers that you flick, in this game you where the football boots. The diagram illustrates this rather well. You kick the ball literally with your boot-encased finger.

The rules allow for free kicks, throw-ins and penalties.

There is a warning that your boot fingers must be on the table at all times, so that should be very friendly with six players, three a side!

name.value: 3 mit Kopf & Pfote: Fit, pfiffig, schlau

item.description: In Play with the coloured balls a lot of disorder has been created, the winner is the first to gather his balls back together, but to be able to do that one must answer questions, do gymnastics with the dog and solve puzzles. Each player has a collecting table and in his turn rolls the die and moves. Depending on the colour of the animal track a ball chip is turned over and one takes a card from the thus determined card stack. The rabbit poses a riddle, fun or logic question, the parrot a knowledge question and the dog sets a movement or a pantomime task. For a correct solution the player receives the chip for his table.

Players take turns rolling to move around the board where they can buy properties and permanent upgrades, defeat monsters and avoid traps, and duel each other for dominance.
Monsters and Traps are on High and Low Level Dungeon cards which players can choose from when they land on a Dungeon tile. After a successful roll which can be modified by upgrades, you can win gold pieces (money). Unsuccessful rolls reduce your hit points. If your hit points reach zero, you're out of the game.
Properties can be purchased and upgraded with housing, affecting the amount of rent opponents must pay when they land on your property. If you collect enough properties of certain types, you can control the castle in that territory, which greatly increases rent.
The right to own properties can also be dueled over by rolling against each other using various modifiers like housing and castles playing a large role in winning or losing.
A player will be deemed the winner when they are the last player with hit points and/or money.

item.description:
In December 1956, paroled rebel Fidel Castro returned to Cuba to launch his revolution with virtually no political base and—after a disastrous initial encounter with government forces—a total of just 12 men. Two years later, through masterful propaganda and factional maneuver, Castro, his brother Raúl, and iconic revolutionary Che Guevara had united disparate guerrillas and exploited Cubans’ deep opposition to their dictator Fulgencio Batista y Zaldívar. Castro’s takeover of the country became a model for Leftist insurgency.

Castro’s Insurgency

Following up on GMT Games’ Andean Abyss about insurgency in modern Colombia, the next volume in the COIN Series, Cuba Libre, takes 1 to 4 players into the Cuban Revolution. Castro’s “26 July Movement” must expand from its bases in the Sierra Maestra mountains to fight its way to Havana. Meanwhile, anti-communist student groups, urban guerrillas, and expatriates try to de-stabilize the Batista regime from inside and out, while trying not to pave the way for a new dictatorship under Castro. Batista’s Government must maintain steam to counter the twin insurgency, while managing two benefactors: its fragile US Alliance and its corrupting Syndicate skim. And in the midst of the turmoil, Meyer Lansky and his Syndicate bosses will jockey to keep their Cuban gangster paradise alive.

COIN Series, Volume II

Cuba Libre will be easy to learn for Andean Abyss players—both volumes share the same innovative GMT COIN Series system. Like Volume I, Cuba Libre is equally playable solitaire or by multiple players up to 4—and with a shorter time to completion than Andean Abyss. But Cuba Libre’s situation and strategic challenges will be new. A deck of 48 fresh events brings 1950s Cuba to life and includes …

• The Twelve: The first wave’s escape to the Sierra Maestra—inspirational legend or harbinger of defeat?
• El Che and Raúl: Brilliant in the field, or bungling hostage-takers?
• Operation Fisherman: Can the rebels pull off a second invasion?
• General Strike: Urban disruption or rebel embarrassment?
• Radio Rebelde: Are the masses tuning in, or just the Army direction finders?
• Pact of Caracas: Can the rebels unite?
• Armored Cars: Mobile striking power, but in whose hands?
• Rolando Masferrer: Brutal pro-government tactics—will they help or hurt?
• Fat Butcher: Can the Mob’s enforcer protect its casinos?
• Sinatra: Frankie’s Havana show a boom or bust, and who collects?
… and much more.

New twists match the COIN Series system to the situation in 1950s Cuba:

• It’s the insurgents who build lasting capabilities, while the Government is limited to fleeting bursts of momentum.
• The Syndicate’s bases are Casinos—expensive to build, but so important to Cuba no army will destroy them. 
• Syndicate special activities include calling in the “muscle” of Government troops and police to protect mob assets. 
• Stacks of Syndicate cash awaiting launder can fall in anyone’s hands—even the corrupt Government’s.
• The Government has its own terror tactic—reprisals—and can skim a portion of Syndicate profits.
• The eroding US Alliance with Batista overshadows all Government actions, not just through aid levels but also through the day-to-day ability of troops and police to operate.
• Even if Batista flees, the struggle may not end—the counterrevolutionary government may even become stronger!

Multiplayer, 2-Player, Solitaire

Cuba Libre provides up to 4 players with contrasting roles and overlapping victory conditions for rich diplomatic interaction. For 2- or 3-player games, players can represent alliances of factions, or the game system can control non-player factions . Or a single player as the Cuban Revolutionaries can attempt to topple Batista and seize power for themselves. The non-player sides will fight one another as well as the players, but too much power in the hands of any one of them will mean player defeat.

More COIN Series Volumes to Come

Andean Abyss and now Cuba Libre present a game system on modern insurgency readily adaptable to other conflicts, particularly those featuring the interaction of many sides (thus the name COunterINsurgency Series). A rich and under-represented history of guerrilla warfare beckons, as modern insurgency offers virtually unlimited, under-gamed topics for the COIN Series. Volume III is A Distant Plainâ€”Insurgency in Afghanistan. Volume IV is Fire in the Lakeâ€”Insurgency in Vietnam.

item.description:
'Flicking through the Ages' is a 2-player dexterity civilization game created as part of the NaGaDeMon contest during the month of November 2011. Aside from the obvious Through the Ages nod, FttA claims Flicochet, Tumblin Dice, Breakout and the classic carnival game of knocking over milk bottles as its primary pedigree.

FttA aims to deliver the civilization 'feel' to a dexterity game playable in under 30 minutes and assembled from easy to find materials. It combines five completely different minigames into a timeless struggle for cultural supremacy! Players balance their actions by using population discs in the following ways:

1. Gather resources by flicking your disc down a platform decreasing in size with increased return for increased risk.
2. Research new technologies by flicking your disc at one of four stacks of available technologies arranged like a breakout game and taking the block you strike. Once obtained, players need to choose whether or not to add the technology to their list of abilities or to trade in the block to increase their population
3. Declare war on the other player's civilization by flicking your disc at their researched technologies stacked in a pyramid. Knock your opponent's blocks down to steal population, technology or colonies
4. Vie for colonies by flicking your disc closer to the colony disc than your opponents
5. Construct Wonders of the World by stacking resource cubes on a disc and sliding it along a path symbolizing the shape of the building without letting one fall

NOTES:

Construction of 'Flicking Through the Ages' requires:
1 set of Jenga-style blocks
1 set (2 colors) of 'bakelite'-style backgammon discs or other discs of roughly 1.25" diameter that flick reasonably well and are heavy enough to impact a tower of Jenga blocks enough to fall over
1 set of the rules including the 'colony' and 'technology' sticker sets to be applied (or taped) to the above components

i See it! - Is a fast-action Electronic word trivia game, where questions light up in a LED display Globe. There are 12 categories and 6 different versions of the game. The game includes more than 7200 challenges. Players try to see what the answer is and hit their buzzer to stop the word as it comes up, then they have to say what it is by seeing it first!

In 8-Bit Invaders, you are defending your home planet from an onslaught of alien invaders. Each turn, you roll six dice and use them to attack the advancing horde; then the aliens march inexorably forward. If you can kill all of the invaders before they land, you win; otherwise, you die.

Designed for the Solitaire Print and Play Contest.

item.description: A memorization game for kids aged 2.5 to 5, the game comes with 9 cute soft plastic animals & insects, flower tokens, and a little box. The players are shown all the animals, then while they close their eyes one animal is hidden inside the box. The players then have to take a guess which animal was hidden in the box. The one who's right gets a flower token. First player to earn five tokens wins!

Objective: be the first to get rid of all your cards

1. each player receives 5 cards (randomly) - other cards will be placed in a stack on the back onto the board
2. turn the top card and place it according the illustrated letter on the board
3a. player left to the starting may place a card with a letter, part of the previous placed card
3b. same player may place a new/additional card on the board if the leading letter is part of previous placed card (3a)
3c. player may continue according above mentioned rule
4. if he/she can't place an additional card next player may 
act in similar way, but if no card can be played a new/additional card must be taken
5. if you empty your hand - you win
golden chip is used to mark the card last played
game was published for two different target groups
children and addults - see editions/images

Details
 Players can experiment with many types of ant, including scouts who root out the enemy and find new resources, honey pot ants who store food, soldier ants who fight, and the dreaded bullet ants who lead assaults.
 Enter the world of an ant nest, and dominate the garden!

Objective: be the first to arrive at your tent with all 4 parts of a golden mask 
players are acting by turns, using 2 dice

players dig for gold - better: parts of a mask

Objective: be the 1st to bring 3 of your 4 planes down to the airport
merely a 'Roll and move' game with one exception:
the action 'Positionswechsel' which means 'change of position'
the more players the better because if the board is 'crowded' this action can be worked out easily

In the summer of 1945 the United States had a firm grasp of the Pacific Theater. Japans once mighty fleet was all but shattered and unable to support any garrisoned island against an U.S. attack. With Iwo Jima taken earlier in the year the U.S. had an island to land damaged bombers that were hitting the mainland island. To launch an invasion of the main island of Japan the U.S. would need a bigger stepping stone to launch from; Okinawa was the answer.

This is a 2 player game set on the island of Okinawa and surrounding waters that recreates the battle between U.S. and Japanese forces during World War 2. The basic rules follow the concepts laid out in Axis & Allies, but combat resolution has been modified to a D12 system. The game can be played to 10 turns or 20 depending on the length of time desired; and victory is determined by the number of airbases held or carriers destroyed. The map is divided into areas that are controlled by the players' armies represented by the plastic Axis & Allies pieces.

The rules incorporate a number of new features to the Axis & Allies style of play including terrain effects, country specific units, and all new unit types including flame tanks and LCMs.

name.value: Bibi Blocksberg: Arte delle pozioni magiche
Bibi Blocksberg: La préparation de potions magiques

item.description:
The young witches Bibi, Schubia, Flauipaui and Arkadia need to pass their exams at the end of the year.

Hextrankkunde tests dexterity. You receive one straw and 5 ingredient chips and try so suck up a chip with the straw and place it into the cauldron. The first player to place all his chips into the cauldron wins the game.

The young witches Bibi, Schubia, Flauipaui and Arkadia need to pass their exams at the end of the year.

Krötenhopsen again tests dexterity. You have one try per toad to snip it into the pond with yor finger. Each toad ending up in the pond, totally or in part, scores 1 point. If the toad touches the water lily, the score is 2 points. The player with the majority of points after 3 rounds wins the game.

name.value: Bibi Blocksberg: La danse des araignées

item.description:
The young witches Bibi, Schubia, Flauipaui and Arkadia need to pass their exams at the end of the year.

Spinnentanz is also a test on dexterity. Two players stand opposite to each other and have a spider fastened to their waistband in the back. Both try simultaneously to place their spider on the card. The first player to do so scores 1 point. When everyone has player has played against everybody else, the player with the highest score wins.

name.value: Bibi Blocksberg: Le savoir de sorcière

item.description:
The young witches Bibi, Schubia, Flauipaui and Arkadia need to pass their exams at the end of the year.

Hexwissen tests knowledge. The referee poses the questions and gives three answers - the first player to call out the correct answer receives the card. The first player who collects four cards wins the game.

The Fat Penguin is an ice-breaker. In the game, players take turns to ask a question of the others. Players secretly choose their answer (red/no or green/yes). Then the asking player has to guess individually what the other players answered for themselves. If the player is correct, then its penguin advances.

The questions varies from everyday-life tendencies and preferences, to life/death and ethical dilemmas, and funny/dirty questions. E.g.: "Have you in the past year used someone elses toothbrush?", "Would you rather give up your mom's love (green) og the respect of your friends (red)?", "What is more unattractive: Too self-confident (green) or too shy (red)?", "Routined sex three times a week (green) or exciting sex once every third week (red)?"

The game is intended as an ice-breaker at parties. The drinking-game variant makes the players take a shot of booze/beer if they are right or wrong.

The game is published in German "Der Fette Pinguin", in English "The Fat Penguin" and in Danish "Den Fede Pingvin". There is also a smartphone App version of the game (available in Danish for iPhone, and soon in English and German and also for Android).

item.description: There are 16 characters from the stories of the little king Macius in this game. Each character consists of four cards (hat, head, belly and legs). The players roll the dice and try to collect all cards and whoever has the most complete figures at the end of the game wins.

name.value: Die Koala Brüder: Tempo, Tempo, Freunde!

item.description: Frank and Buster give a party so big, that no one can really keep an eye on all the guests. Who can find the combinations of guests first? One player rolls the dice and all players simultaneously look for the characters rolled. They can be on one or more cards, but must be adjacent do each other, diagonal combinations do not count. For a correct combination a player receives all tiles in the combination, for an error one looses a card. When the draw pile is finished the player with the most cards wins.

Invented by a Korean dad who wanted to help his kids learn how to master and conquer math. Throughout the game, you simply add up 3 tiles to make a sum of "10," 3 and 4 tiles to make a sum of "20." Each color is played separately and the black tiles are joker tiles. The goal of the game is to get rid of your tiles first!

You and your friends are going on a photo safari! To see as many animals as possible, you will have to plan your trip well. Whoever visits the most areas and takes the best photographs will be the safari champion!

In DiceAFARI, you select a route to visit on the animal-shaped map by rolling the custom dice strategically – but choose wisely because routes are limited and other players can revisit the areas you select. Be sure to take a photo of an animal you see before someone else does. Once the entire map has been visited, points are scored for sets of photos taken and areas most recently visited. The player with the most points wins!

Minions brings the classic web-based style game called 'Tower Defense' to your table top. Two criminal masterminds send waves of minions to destroy the enemy HQ. To keep the minions away, each player deploys a variety of towers to eliminate those pesky minions. The first player to sneak three minions through their enemy's defensive perimeter succeeds in destroying the enemy HQ and winning the game.

Minions uses a variable map system allowing different paths each time you play. Machine Guns, Cannons, Missiles, and Death Rays abound to frustrate the Minions' attempts at destruction.

item.description:
Power Trip is a thrilling, fast-paced card game that can change directions at any time. Players race to get rid of all their cards first by attempting to match or beat the cards played by others, or by playing a Clear or Power Trip card to clear the discard pile. The first player to do so becomes the Ruler. Be the first player to become Ruler three times to WIN THE GAME. Play out of turn to complete four of a kind and use Action and Rule cards to squash your competition.

Easily score your Power Trip games and keep players on the edge of their seats by generating new and existing rule cards with the iPhone and Android Power Trip app.

item.description:
Top Promoter is a new card game for 3-5 players in which players try to make more money than their opponents. By putting their fighters in the best position for the big payday, players increase their chances of victory!

Each player has his own deck of 15 fighters and five action cards. Each round, players simultaneously play a fighter face-down, then reveal them at the same time. These cards get played into locations that are in the center of the table following certain rules. Once a location has three fights, the fights are resolved through dice.

Each fighter has a number of dice he rolls that can be modified with action cards or by fighting in his home location. The number of dice can range from 1-7 dice, and whoever rolls the single highest die wins! However, some fighters have a signature move that will guarantee victory!

Top Promoter is a light game that inspires trash talking and cheering as the underdog takes down the favorite!

item.description:
An abstract strategy game for 2 players that adds a twist to the classic black vs. white setup: grey pieces that belong equally to both players.

The game mechanism revolves around enclosure (either partial or full) of other, single pieces on a square grid board. Surrounded pieces can be either removed from play, replaced with upgraded pieces, or can cause extra turns or even a win, depending on the degree of enclosure (i.e. being surrounded by either 6, 7, or 8 pieces belonging to the player) and also the color of central piece being enclosed.

A turn consists of a player either placing or moving a piece, and then acting out consequences if their move results in one or more enclosure situations. In standard game play, the color of the piece to be played (either the player's own color or grey) is decided by the flip of a fair coin, but the game can also be played without that element of chance by simply alternating between the two.

The game ends either when a player causes a piece to be entirely enclosed with pieces belonging to them filling all 8 surrounding squares (in which case they are the winner), or in the event that no open spaces remain on the board (in which case the player with the most pieces of their specific color is the winner.)

The game is both fun for beginners and yet dynamic enough to also engage experienced strategists.

item.description:
Viva la ResistANTS! is an abstract boardgame. Main game mechanics includes area controll, set collection and 'press your luck'. It combines American and European styles of boardgaming design. The game has a unique setting. The forces of Resistance of Ants led by the mysterious Serg Ant try to help the civilians survive under the occupation of enemy forces, who perfidiously attacked the peaceful republic of ants. Now you must fight for your freedom. Let's say together: Viva la ResistANTS!

Each player has a detachment of 10 ants. Each turn the player can send 2 of them to the field to participate in a special mission or withdraw 1-3 of them. At the start of the game the playfield is generated randomly. If 1 or more ants get status missing in action, players should shuffle the tiles of the playfield and generate it randomly again. Other ants return to players. The ants get status missing in action if a card from alert deck with the appropriate colour is revealed for the second time. One card from alert deck is revealed every time each player takes a turn. If the same colour is revealed for the third time the alert deck must be shuffled. If it must be shuffled for the second time, the game is over. The player who gets more victory points becomes a winner. In case of a tie, the winner is the player who retained more ants.

The players have to collect 8 knowledge chips of every color. The chips are rewarded for answering one of 2200 questions out of different areas
During player's turn die is rolled; he/she may move into any direction, but not vice versa; occupied spaces may be crossed.
Appropriate card is drawn, die is used to pick a question - if the answer is correct, player may add an additional turn - moving again. You pick a chip if you find a correct answer for a space on the outer circle.

A fast and fun party game based on questions and dexterity!

A good materials inside the box. You must Slam the plastic hammers on a category to answer at the questions!
During each round the reader in turn must take an Action card and follow what it says: for example, you must read the question and talk with a "french accent" or cover an eye with your hand.
Moreover, the player reads the question without reading the category; who knows the answer must slam the hammer on a board in the space of the correct category!

A fast party game from 3 to 24 players!

Based on a popoular TV Show aired in Italy from 12 years continuously; the "Iene" are journalists who report on investigations of fraud and political problems.

In the Game "Le IENE" each player has a secret rule: he can be a "Iena" or a Cheater.

The Cheaters characters are: the doctor, the medium, the manufacturer and the politician.

In his turn the player can:
- choose an area in the city and gain money for all the cheaters pawns in that area.
- move a character pawns to one area from another and take objects.
- accuse another player to be a Cheater.
- interview another player, so he can have more information about his identity.

There will not possible to gain money or take objects when a "Iena" pawns is in that area. Infact the cheaters can make illagal traffic of money when the "Iene" aren't there for an interview!

At the end, if the "Iene" players found the right association between players-cheaters they win: otherwise, players gain/loose money according to their accusations, objects and interviews and the player with most money will be the winner.

Based on a TV Quiz Show aired in Italy.

There are more than 300 different cards with a transformed or masked image that represents a famous person, an animal, an object, a monument, a painting or a sculpture.

The active player must to recognize the subject of the pic and gain points.

Fun little game, with 4 different variants, based on good observation and quick thinking.
In Lumacorsa, a family card game about snail-racing, players have to bet on the snails involved in the race. A player can alter the speed of the snails by playing cards from his hand.

item.description:
Objective: collect as many quality coconuts as possible
- moving by turns -
1. Preparation of the game - place all coconut tiles face down (good and bad) on dedicated fields
2. roll the die and move - if the die shows the tiger move back to your starting place
3. if you step on a coconut - pick it up and check 
4. if you land on an opponent's meeple - steal a coconut and put her/him in the middle of the board (palm tree)
5. if there are only 4 or less coconuts on the board use a rolled '4' to move AND steal a coconut from a player

Die Spielidee: 2 - 4 Affen rasen auf die Lichtung und jagen nach Kokosnüssen. Dabei passiert eine ganze Menge. Der Tiger ist auch unterwegs und den mögen die Affen nicht. Wer zum Schluss die meisten Kokosnüsse (geklaut) hat, ist nicht unbedingt Sieger, denn es gibt auch faule Nüsse.

item.description:
Objective: be the first to reach the finish line
- moving by turns -
1. place the meeples on the starting position
2. turn the spinner and draw a question card
3. there is one minute left to find an appropriate answer - starting with the letter the spinner is pointing on
4. if you fail roll the die - if the number matches with correspondent letter number you may move, too
5. if spinner points at a symbol act as described

You are a solitary hero fighting to survive in a world once afflicted by ancient wars between Orcs, Elves, Humans and Angels and other Races (included in the expansions Cripta, Covo, Alchimista).

It does not matter if you are a Mage, a Paladin or a Warrior (or another Class contained in Cripta, Covo, Alchimista expansions); all you have to do is to get the most powerful equipment you can find, such as handcrafted swords and shields, spells or what remains of the fire guns and hi-tech weapons produced by a now-gone civilisation.

Defend yourself and defeat your opponents. Are you ready to fight?

Warage is the ultimate turn-based strategic card game: role play, strategy and deck building merged all together for endless adventures.

item.description: A mathematical game for 2 to 4 players. Each player has 9 balls in his game colour. The playing field is 6x6 and numbered from 1 to 36. If it is your turn, you have one minute (egg timer) to roll 3 regular dice and arrange them in a formula with the four basic mathematical operations. The result is where you put your ball. The target space must be unoccupied. If you can not create a formula in one minute for a free space your turn ends. If you achieve 3 or more own balls in a row you get VP. If you get five own balls in a row the game ends. The first to have no more balls ends the game also. Player with the most points wins.

Objective: collect as many precious treasurers as possible & try to block other players
- moving by turns -
1. shuffle treasure cards and put 3 of them upside down on the board - place all the track tiles,too
2. roll the die - move your meeple into direction of a treasure
3. at the end of your turn you may turn a track tile at 90° degree to the left or right (blocking or preparing your route)
4. if you roll a 'wand' you may exchange one of your treasures for another player's one (different values)
5. if all treasures a collected count up the values printed on the tile

item.description:
In Rise!, players race to be the first to construct three towers on the growing game board, moving workers to and fro to keep the towers rising and the opponent befuddled.

To set up, place 12 hexagonal tiles in a dogbone shape as specified in the rulebook, then place one token for each player on their starting locations. On a turn, a player takes two actions (possibly the same action twice) from this list of options:


 Place a land tile adjacent to any existing tile.
 Place a worker adjacent to any of your workers already on the game board.
 Move one of your workers to an adjacent empty space.
 Jump an opponent's worker and land on an empty space, removing that worker from play.
 Remove two of your workers from the board to remove an opponent's worker from any space.
 Remove two of your workers from the board to place one of your workers in any empty space.
 Remove one of your tower layers from the board.


If at any time during play you have a circle of six of your workers surrounding an empty space, place the first layer of one of your towers in that space. Your ring of workers must remain in place for two additional turns for the remaining two layers to be added to the tower; if your ring is disrupted, you can complete it later to continue the tower-building. If you completely surround an opponent's tower, you can remove the top level of that tower from the board.

In addition to building three complete towers, a player can also win by eliminating all of the opponent's workers from the game board.

item.description:
In Shake Shake Tower – this game's original name – players start the game with eight 3D curved polyomino pieces in a single color, then take turns placing them on a swiveling, seesaw-style platform. Gravity pulls the platform and pieces from side to side as the tower rises, so players might have a tough time adding a piece to the stack – especially since each level must be filled before players can play on top of other bricks. If a player can't legally play, she must skip her turn, so play strategically to block others while leaving yourself room to grow!

If you knock pieces off the tower, you keep them on the side, losing one point for each brick in such a piece. When a player plays her final piece, the game ends. Players then score one point for each brick of theirs visible from a top-down view of the tower. Whoever has the high score wins.

Tremblex, a revised version of Shake Shake Tower, uses the same pieces and nearly the same scoring method, but players are free to place pieces as they wish on the tower – with one small exception that drives play in a different direction. Each piece you place must touch one of your pieces already in play; if all of your pieces have been covered by other players, then you're forced to sit out until someone else knocks pieces off the tower! Once this happens, all players are back in the game. The game ends when a player places her final piece, and players tally their scores, earning one point for each brick showing from a top-down view of the tower, losing one point for each brick in pieces knocked off the tower, and collecting a three point bonus if their piece is highest up in the tower.

Tremblex includes variant rules as well, such as a cooperative mode in which players try to complete the tower with no holes and a two-player game in which opponents place pieces only on their half of the platform, trying to scale higher than the other player in order to win.

Objective: be the first to visit 5 capital cities within Europe
- moving by turn -
1st choose side of the map (geographical or political)
2nd draw card to find starting position
3rd draw additional 5 cards and 'form' a route
4th roll the die and move your meeple
5th you may use cards (max 2 =) ship and plane tickets instead of your die
5th if the roll shows a symbol draw an action card and proceed
as described

Fury, a game of fantasy warfare, brings the Manoeuvre game system to the lands of the West. Knights and Orcs fight against Dragons and Dwarves to decide the outcome of the 2nd War of the West. Fury takes the bones of Manoeuvre and builds a game that has more of everything you like in the original. More and varied types of movement such as flight and teleportation, more combats in a turn each with their own deadly styles, and devastating spells that can turn the tides of war in your favor. Your ability to control the Fury of the battlefield will determine your fate.

Fury includes armies for each of the nations of the west including; the Elves of the Woodland Realm, The Dwarves of the Kingdom of Zikkim, The Theocracy of Tayanna, The Nik’tmarg a loose conglomeration of humanoids and savage men, Badari the desert empire, The Republic of Toren, Medis the feudal lands of the wizards and Tireisis feared by all as the domain of the Necromancer. In addition Fury adds in many small nations and mercenary bands that can swing a battle in your favor.

The map boards now include mountains and desert in addition to the basic land types introduced in Manoeuvre. Other additions are territorial objectives, spells, various methods of Attack and Defense. The game includes more and varied types of Movement, expanded leader capabilities and involvement. The card mix also allows more combat from every unit through the use of generic nationality cards that can be utilized by any unit on your side. Fury turns the orderly Napoleonic battlefield on its head and populates it with Goblins, Zealots and Zombies ready to fight for their cause.

For many more details on each nation as well as the mercenary units, visit Jeff Horger's design blog at: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/blog/857/fury

Components:

36 Terrain Tiles
8 Nations consisting of 9 Units and 49 Cards each
23 Mercenary Units with 3 Cards each
2 Sheets of 1” Counters
Rules
8 Nation-Specific Player Aids
2 Mercenary/Terrain Player Aids
Dice (4d6, 4d8, 4d10)
Playing Time is 30-60 minutes
Complexity= 3
Solo Rating= 1
